description: Those looking to complete the initial Mac Integration Basics exam to obtain the Apple Certified Associates (ACA) Certification will find in this course an overview of the process in achieving the certification and details about the exam required to pass in order to receive the certification. One will learn in this course how to use Mac OS in a corporate/ enterprise environment, integrate it with other systems, and learn how to perform actions such as sharing files, printers, and other things that run between multiple systems running Mac OS.
name: Mac Integration Basics 10.9
subtitle: Mavericks 10.9

episodes.description: The Apple Certified Associate (ACA) certification is an entry level certification that shows one has a basic understanding of how to use Mac OS in a corporate or enterprise environment and can integrate it with other systems. The ACA certification can be achieved in two versions through either Mac Integration Basics or Mac Management Basics and is an excellent starting point for people working with Macintosh systems in a networked environment. Viewers will hear an overview about the knowledge one needs to attain the ACA certification, about the Mac Integration Basics Exam and the exam objectives of topics one should know for the exam.
episodes.title: Overview of Mac Integration Basics

episodes.description: A lot of the Mac operating system is directed more towards home users, but in corporate, business, or enterprise environments the need for network functions usually arise. Viewers will hear about Open Directory, Active Directory, and the process of binding a client to a directory for the purpose of centralized user management.
episodes.title: Network Accounts

episodes.description: Being able to share information between systems is an important step in setting up a Mac to work in a network environment. Viewers will hear about the different methods for file sharing that are supported and see demonstrations for Mac-to-Mac and Mac-to-Windows file sharing.
episodes.title: File Sharing

episodes.description: In taking a look at Mac integration, connecting to various network services can make some things more convenient for the user. Viewers will hear about the process of integrating email, calendars, and contacts in with the Mac system.
episodes.title: Email, Calendars, and Contacts

episodes.description: Mac OS has a ton of security features built into it, but not all are initially enabled, so one should utilize the features according to their needs. Viewers will hear about the different modes in Password Assistant and other security features including setting firmware passwords, enabling FileVault and the firewall, and others.
episodes.title: Security

episodes.description: Printers are still a very common and useful device, especially in business type settings that rely on printed documentation. Viewers will hear about the process of adding printers to a system and the different types of printers Mac OS supports.
episodes.title: Printing

episodes.description: iMessage is a software package that's included with Mac OS used for instant messaging. Viewers will see demonstrations on how to configure iMessage and to set it up to a Jabber/ XMPP server, and also hear how it works and what all it does.
episodes.title: Instant Message

episodes.description: Backing up and managing data is important especially when transferring data to new systems and when wanting to avoid data loss in the event of a hard drive failure or a similar instance. Viewers will hear about moving system information over from Windows to Mac through the Migration Assistant tool, other ways Apple recommends moving data between systems, and the backup process through Time Machine.
episodes.title: Data Management and Backup

episodes.description: Cross-platform compatibility refers to the ability of certain software or applications to operate across multiple platforms as opposed to only one. Viewers will hear about how to virtualize a Windows environment on a Mac, how Boot Camp works to create a dual bootable system, and the steps in getting Boot Camp set up.
episodes.title: Cross-Platform Compatibility
